verbs.description: decommission (third-person singular simple present decommissions, present participle decommissioning, simple past and past participle decommissioned)

entries.meaning: To take out of service or to render unusable.
examples: They decommissioned the ship after the accident.
The Army decommissioned the Sherman tank by filling the turret with cement.

entries.meaning: To remove or revoke a commission.
examples: After his arrest, the officer was decommissioned from the police force.

entries.meaning: To remove or revoke a formal designation.
examples: The state highway was decommissioned and reverted to local control.
